ko: "이 가루약 왜 이렇게 달아? 설탕 같아!" "에리스리톨이 들어있어서 그래."

en: Many a tears were shed, but no words were spoken.
ko: 눈물은 많이 흘렸지만, 아무 말도 없었어.

en: A boy who sees a squirrel without a place to hide from him who turns to run away decides to chase it.
ko: 자기를 피해 숨을 곳도 없이 도망치려는 다람쥐를 본 한 소년이 그 다람쥐를 쫓아가기로 마음먹었어.

en: Go there by yourself.
Getting home will take us at the very least an hour.
ko: 집에 가는 데 적어도 한 시간은 걸릴 거야.

en: Getting home will take you at the very least an hour.
ko: 너 집에 가는 데 적어도 한 시간은 걸릴 거야.

en: Every day, we get at the very least three clients at the shop.
ko: 우리 가게에는 매일 손님이 최소 세 명은 와.

en: You won't find opportunities like this more than twice a year.
ko: 이런 기회는 일 년에 두 번도 안 올걸.

en: We get at least three customers in our shop every day.
ko: 우리 가게엔 매일 적어도 손님이 세 명은 있어.

en: At least three customers come into our shop every day.
ko: 매일 최소 세 명의 손님이 우리 가게에 들어와.

en: Is Santa coming this year?
I can't go out dressed like this. Can you wait a little? I'll change right away.
ko: 이런 차림으로는 못 나가. 조금만 기다려 줄래? 금방 갈아입고 올게.

en: I can finish that project within three weeks at most.
ko: 그 프로젝트는 길어봐야 3주면 끝낼 수 있어.

en: I want my own house.
Where are the coffee beans?
I eat before seven in the evening.
Could you help me put these bags into the car?
ko: 이 가방들 차에 싣는 것 좀 도와줄래?

en: Tom is buying the latest faddy VR headset just so that you can watch him use it.
ko: 톰은 자기가 쓰는 거 너보고 구경하라고 유행하는 최신 VR 헤드셋을 사고 있어.

en: Because of the time difference, I want to call you at a time that works best for the both of us. In terms of Japan time, when are you able to call?
ko: 시차 때문에 우리 둘 다 편한 시간에 전화하고 싶어. 일본 시간으로 언제 전화 가능해?

en: This is my first time in this shop so I don't know what's recommended. Do you have any recommendations you could give me?
ko: 이 가게는 처음이라 뭐가 맛있는지 모르겠네. 추천해 줄 만한 거 있어?

en: Recently I've been going to this shop a lot. The atmosphere is good, the customers are nice, and it's just really calming. How many years have you been working at this shop? Do you find it rewarding to work here?
ko: 요즘 이 가게에 자주 오고 있어. 분위기도 좋고 손님들도 매너 있고 정말 편안해. 여기서 일한 지 몇 년 됐어? 일하는 거 보람 있어?

en: The table I'm trying to use is dirty so I'm looking for a tablecloth. Where is one? Could you give me one?
ko: 앉으려는 테이블이 더러워서 식탁보를 찾고 있는데, 어디 있어? 하나만 줄 수 있어?

en: Since then I’ve asked my school some questions over email, but so far I haven't really had an answer. I’m not really able to trust them now. What do you think I can do to calm things down?
ko: 그 뒤로 학교에 이메일로 몇 가지 물어봤는데 아직 답이 없어. 이제 학교를 못 믿겠어. 상황을 좀 진정시키려면 어떻게 해야 할까?

en: I was instantly smitten with her—her face, her personality—and wanted to stay with her forever. And I'm really worried about how I can get together with her and how I can prevent other guys from getting to her. Could you please assist me in making this love a reality and making her fall in love with me as well?
ko: 그 애 외모랑 성격에 한눈에 반해서 평생 함께하고 싶어졌어. 어떻게 하면 그 애랑 잘될 수 있을지, 다른 남자들이 못 다가가게 하려면 어떡해야 할지 정말 걱정돼. 이 사랑이 이루어지고 그 애도 날 좋아하게 되도록 좀 도와줄래?

en: I keep wondering how I can improve my English. Sometimes I can't explain what I'm trying to say or what the situation is, or I just can't come up with a good way to describe it myself. How do you think I can improve?
ko: 어떻게 하면 영어를 더 잘할 수 있을지 계속 고민이야. 가끔은 하고 싶은 말이나 상황을 설명하기 힘들고, 적당한 표현이 잘 안 떠올라. 어떻게 하면 늘 수 있을까?

en: Something caught my attention recently. I usually say hello or something similar at the start of messages before moving on to the topic of the message. But, surprisingly, I've seen a lot of people dive right into the topic and send nothing else. What's up with that?
ko: 최근에 좀 특이한 걸 발견했어. 난 보통 메시지 보낼 때 인사를 먼저 하고 본론을 말하거든. 근데 의외로 인사도 없이 바로 본론만 말하는 사람들이 많더라고. 왜 그러는 걸까?

en: I've been thinking I might want to engage in small talk with my Uber driver, but I'm not sure what to talk about or what to ask. Could you give me any ideas as to what I should talk about?
ko: 우버 기사님이랑 가벼운 대화를 좀 해보고 싶은데, 무슨 말을 하거나 물어봐야 할지 모르겠어. 어떤 대화를 하면 좋을지 아이디어 좀 줄래?

en: Change it however you need to.
The long and the short of it is that I was sacked.
Brazil finished runners-up in the 1998 World Cup.
Children grow up really fast.
Your hijab is a lovely color.
"Are you insane?" "Yes."
Why do Muslims memorize the Quran?
Are you learning two foreign languages at the same time?
ko: 외국어 두 개를 동시에 배우고 있어?

en: Who do you think you are to be grinning like that?
ko: 네가 뭔데 그렇게 히죽히죽 웃고 있어?

en: Japanese food is very different from anything that I had while growing up.
ko: 일본 음식은 내가 자라면서 먹어본 것들이랑은 정말 달라.

en: Mina became a nurse's aid.
I guess I don't really feel like travelling.
ko: 나 여행 갈 기분이 아닌가 봐.

en: The train crashed into a truck.
I clashed with him over the matter.
I'd like to book a single room.
I rang her, but the number was engaged.
That was far more complicated than I thought.
Tom has been in clinical treatment for addiction for the last five years.
ko: 톰은 지난 5년 동안 중독 치료를 받아왔어.

en: If you disagree with him, don't be afraid to say so.
ko: 그 사람 의견에 반대한다면 겁내지 말고 말해.

en: I found this book at a second-hand bookshop.
Prices will go up after 20 October.
Our trip was cancelled because of heavy snow.
If anything happens, ring me straight away.
The next meeting will take place on 10 June.
When did you arrive? Today?
I have a headache but no other symptoms.
ko: 머리만 좀 아프고 다른 증상은 없어.

en: You can't buy these from a shop.
Ring me back.
Phone me back.
I go red just thinking about it.
I want a chewy sweet.
Mr White's garden is large.
I like to try everything, so I decided to join immediately.
ko: 뭐든 다 해보는 걸 좋아해서 바로 가입하기로 했어.

en: Next year is a leap year.
You look like your mother when she was young.
ko: 너희 엄마 젊었을 때랑 똑같이 생겼다.

en: You look like your mother did when she was young.
ko: 너희 엄마 젊었을 때 모습이랑 닮았어.

en: Tom didn't want to stay at home alone.
The caller hung up without saying anything.
ko: 전화 건 사람이 아무 말도 없이 끊어버렸어.

en: I've noticed that just like Tails, I have self-esteem problems, partly because of my childhood, when my classmates treated me badly for being different, but I keep fighting anyways to be better. Plus, he likes helping and is sweet and friendly, same as I want to be. Maybe that's why I've always liked him so much and identify so much with him.
ko: 나도 테일즈처럼 자존감 문제가 있다는 걸 깨달았어. 어느 정도는 어릴 때 남들과 다르다는 이유로 친구들한테 괴롭힘당했던 것 때문이기도 한데, 그래도 더 나은 사람이 되려고 계속 노력 중이야. 게다가 테일즈는 도와주는 거 좋아하고 다정하고 친절하잖아. 나도 그런 사람이 되고 싶거든. 그래서 내가 걔를 항상 좋아했고 공감도 많이 했던 것 같아.

en: I liked him from the start.
I avoid drinking coffee in the evening.
Excuse me. Is anyone home?
Is this how I'm going to die?
Even monkeys fall from trees. But I can't even climb.
ko: 원숭이도 나무에서 떨어진다는데, 난 올라가지도 못해.

en: What made you think it was Tom?
I'm tired but I can't sleep.
My grandma is 93 years old. She first known about Facebook about two years back, and about a year ago she got her first smartphone.
ko: 우리 할머니는 아흔세 살이셔. 한 2년 전쯤에 페이스북을 처음 아셨고, 1년 전쯤에 첫 스마트폰을 장만하셨어.

en: As I approached the door, it opened.
The company makes vegan ground beef that tastes just like the real thing.
ko: 그 회사는 진짜 고기 맛이 나는 비건 다짐육을 만들어.

en: Where's my kid?
Where's our kid?
Tom is only interested in football.
Tom is interested only in football.
Laser is currently operating! Use extreme caution!
Where's the box of tissues?
The movie was very interesting and kept me hooked till the end.
ko: 그 영화 진짜 재밌어서 끝까지 눈을 못 뗐어.

en: You lose your lip balm again?
Did you lose your lip balm again?
What triggers regression?
You've forgotten the question mark.
I will not take the Corona vaccine.
ko: 난 코로나 백신 안 맞을 거야.

en: It must have been at least ten times.
You're not Spaniards.
I started, but I didn't finish.
Let's meet on Saturday!
I started but didn't finish.
Which cup should I use?
Which glass should I use?
Let me know when you leave work so I can warm up dinner.
ko: 저녁 데워 놓을 테니까 퇴근할 때 알려줘.

en: I watched Ghost in the Shell today.
Can I smoke?
Can I smoke a cigarette?
Coming!
What a bastard!
We're also going to buy a bottle of red wine.
ko: 우리 레드 와인 한 병도 살 거야.

en: They should be here.
You should be here.
She should be here.
The newspaper is delivered to my doorstep every morning by the local delivery boy.
ko: 매일 아침 배달부가 집 앞까지 신문을 배달해 줘.

en: Why do you want to learn Dutch?
No one could have known.
She is always late.
He is always late.
Oh, that's a shame!
Your girlfriend is older than me.
Tell me a good story.
It's in the past.
To be honest, I love myself.
ko: 솔직히 말해서, 난 내 자신을 사랑해.

en: Did you practice your piano this morning?
The meat is cheap.
We're done!
Do you also collect coins?
It is true, it is not a joke.
I don't need to explain anything.
Let's give these chocolates to grandma.
We watch telly all the time.
He beat his wife.
What are you guys doing this weekend?
We arrived in Rotterdam on Tuesday.
I can barely pay my bills!
Peter is my eldest son.
Maria will win.
These flowers start blooming in spring.
When do you plan to get back?
Did you all work together?
Why is February shorter than the other months?
Black beetles are stronger than red beetles.
ko: 검은 딱정벌레가 빨간 딱정벌레보다 힘이 세.

en: How many days are in a year?
By the time we arrived the concert had ended.
ko: 우리가 도착했을 때는 이미 콘서트가 끝나 있었어.

en: You should know.
Before I knew it, I didn't want to see you again.
ko: 나도 모르는 사이에 널 다시는 보고 싶지 않아졌어.

en: How much does a night cost?
Your cat is too fat.
I wrote a letter to Anna, but it came back.
I wrote a letter to Anna, but it was returned to me.
ko: 안나한테 편지를 썼는데 나한테 다시 돌아왔어.

en: "Can I ask you a question?" "No."
Some countries don't recognize same-sex marriages.
ko: 어떤 나라들은 동성 결혼을 인정하지 않아.

en: She's young and pretty.
My name is Marina.
Does this kind of thing happen a lot?
Wait until he's back.
I am a native speaker of British English.
Enjoy your youth.
I see something, but I don't know what it is.
We have a son and a daughter.
ko: 우린 아들 하나 딸 하나 있어.

en: I'm seriously too busy, so I can't come tonight.
ko: 나 진짜 너무 바빠서 오늘 밤엔 못 가.

en: What is the mystery flavour?
What is the secret of the flavour?
